page.title: 01Hare Appletree Fell
page.content: A typical rural block of mainly farmland to the south west of the Lancaster to Clithoroe road being the Westerly end of a most attractive tourist route known as the Trough of Bowland, an area of outstanding natural beauty. Land to the north east of the highway is largely morland and heath rising to over the 500m contour of grit stone providing gather ing grounds for the public water supply. An area favoured by walkers, bird watchers and nature study enthusiast generally. One interesting monument in Square 7 is the Jubile Tower erected to mark Queen victoria's dialmond Jubilee which affords a fine vantae point over Morecombe Bay to the Lake District mountains to the west.
